name: places/ChIJESyix3D2wokR9ZTb6ZQC2WI
formattedAddress: 2350 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2350 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA

editorialSummary.text: Hip indoor cycling studio with high-intensity spinning classes in a cozy, subterranean space.

originalText.text:
This review is long overdue! I've been going to classes at Harlem Cycle since February of this year and love them because the instructors are so friendly and engaging! The instructors also remember you and your progress, which I find very motivating!

I appreciate the variety of classes they offer such as combined classes with cycling and weights! I'd say my favorite class is Harlem Sculpt because it’s primarily focused on lifting weights. I’ve found the instructors are very mindful of their students and are happy to help you improve your form and make modifications to exercises when necessary!

The staff is friendly and welcoming, which makes me look forward to coming to class! Lastly, I love that they organize community events like bike rides and the fall hike!

originalText.text: Oh I’ve had an amazing experience at Harlem cycle! From Bernex’s high energy rides to Shelly‘s soca sessions it’s been wonderful. All my classes have been engaging and fantastic. I always feel welcomed when I enter their studios and I feel supported along my fitness journey.

text.text: Oh I’ve had an amazing experience at Harlem cycle! From Bernex’s high energy rides to Shelly‘s soca sessions it’s been wonderful. All my classes have been engaging and fantastic. I always feel welcomed when I enter their studios and I feel supported along my fitness journey.

originalText.text: This place & community is so fun & encouraging! Always get to enjoy a great workout with good music led by an awesome instructor. Honestly, this has made spin/cycle class a big part of my workout routine & I highly recommend it. Try a class!

text.text: This place & community is so fun & encouraging! Always get to enjoy a great workout with good music led by an awesome instructor. Honestly, this has made spin/cycle class a big part of my workout routine & I highly recommend it. Try a class!

originalText.text:
*Support Black-Owned Businesses*

I have been putting off jumping back into working out since I have left the military. As a disabled veteran, it can be difficult to motivate myself to get into the things like exercise, etc. Last week I decided to go all in and I purchased the Vibranium membership (20 classes & 2 Guest Passes/mo) and went to my first class on Mar 10. As of Mar 15 I had only not gone one day (rest is important)!

When you enter Harlem Cycle, you walk right into a cozy waiting area and shop that has water bottles, Beyonce-themed candles, healthy snacks, and more! The staff are incredibly kind and make a great effort to remember who you are. All of the items for sale are incredibly reasonable in price for the quality that you get.

The workouts take you to the club, if the club happens to be up some very steep hills. I have now had 4 different people's classes and each one brings its own vibe, but that vibe is always a bop. As someone who /hates/ going to the gym because of the monotony, I really enjoy that I can get lost in the music and vibe while getting enthusiastic encouragement to push myself.

Another nice thing is that there is no skill level requirement. The staff will help you set up your bike, and will constantly encourage  you to listen to your body on how hard to push yourself.

If you were wondering if you should give it a go, this is an excellent place to get your feet wet. I'm hooked and will likely be going 5x a week for the foreseeable future!

originalText.text: I'm absolutely obsessed with Harlem Cycle. I recently discovered this hidden gem and I couldn't be happier that such place exists in the daily NY hustle. The team is AMAZING, they bring tons of positive energy and motivation on the classes, the studios are EXTREMELY clean (clean towels for each member, water fountain available, fresh air, etc.) This is literally the only fitness studio that I've been to that doesn't have the "odor of sweat". I got myself a package (and gear) from them and looking forward to my next ride!
